channel.title: Collaboration on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in Collaboration on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: github: Pinned comments on GitHub Issues
item.description:
GitHub Issues now supports pinning a comment on an issue to keep key information visible and reduce noise while scanning discussions.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Reporting in Playwright Workspaces (part of Azure App Testing)
item.description:
Azure App Testing has made reporting in Playwright Workspaces generally available, delivering an integrated, flexible and collaborative reporting experience to help teams debug Playwright tests more quickly and efficiently.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Databricks Dashboard subscriptions now support Microsoft Teams
item.description:
Azure Databricks dashboard subscriptions can now deliver insights directly into Microsoft Teams (Public Preview), bringing timely, actionable data into team workflows and reducing the need to separately check dashboards.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: security: Collaborative research by Microsoft and NVIDIA on real-time immunity
item.description:
Microsoft and NVIDIA published a joint research post on the Microsoft Security Blog about collaborative work investigating real-time immunity.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Databricks One in Azure Databricks
item.description:
Databricks One is available in Azure Databricks as a public preview offering a unified, simplified platform that combines data engineering, analytics, and AI development into a single, governed environment with integrated collaboration and enterprise governance.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Multiple assignees for issues and pull requests now available in all repositories
item.description:
GitHub announced that issues and pull requests can now have multiple assignees, and the feature is available across all public and private repositories.

  • Source: GitHub
